agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: County Affairs TIME & DATE: 9:00 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or during reading and referrals if permission granted. Thursday, April 18, 2019 PLACE: E2.028 CHAIR: Rep. Garnet Coleman The committee will meet to hear pending business and hear testimony on the following bills: SB 289 Lucio Relating to disaster housing recovery. SB 710 Creighton | et al. Relating to authorization for the creation of a county ethics commission in any county. HB 1473 Middleton | et al. Relating to disclosure of certain relationships with local government officers and vendors. HB 1624 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to the annual state contribution to counties for statutory probate court judge salaries. HB 1927 Herrero Relating to the filling of a vacancy in the office of county commissioner. HB 2612 Perez Relating to the establishment of a constable's department civil service system in certain counties; creating an offense. HB 2808 Shaheen Relating to the publication of required notice by a political subdivision by alternative media and on the Internet. HB 2986 Israel Relating to purchasing of cloud computing services by a political subdivision. HB 3060 Parker Relating to the recording by a county clerk of certain documents concerning real or personal property. HB 3126 Herrero Relating to county community and economic development programs. HB 3294 Raymond Relating to reimbursing a commissioners court for the reasonable cost of transporting a body for the purpose of an autopsy. HB 3690 Middleton Relating to authorizing counties to adopt a code of ethics for their commissioners courts. HB 3714 Parker Relating to the establishment of street lights along county roads in the unincorporated area of certain counties. HB 3716 Parker Relating to the establishment of the office of medical examiner in certain counties. HB 3910 Sherman, Sr. Relating to the establishment of one or more supplemental county civil service commissions in certain counties. HB 4022 Dominguez Relating to the compensation of an assistant county auditor. HB 4125 Israel Relating to the creation of tenant legal services offices by counties to represent indigent residential tenants in eviction cases. HB 4339 Bohac Relating to the authority of certain counties to use an alternate work period for county peace officers. HB 4549 Toth Relating to the clearance of a ditch for the purpose of flood prevention by certain counties. HB 4646 Harless Relating to the powers and duties of the Cy-Champ Public Utility District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose a tax. HB 4662 Calanni Relating to the creation of the Richfield Ranch Management District of Harris County, Texas; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4683 Stucky Relating to the creation of the Hunter Ranch Improvement District No. 1 of Denton County, Texas; providing authority to impose an assessment, impose a tax, and issue bonds. HB 4693 Stucky Relating to the creation of the Cole Ranch Improvement District No. 1 of Denton County, Texas; providing authority to impose an assessment, impose a tax, and issue bonds. HB 4721 Zerwas Relating to the Texas Heritage Parkway Improvement District. HB 4731 Bell, Cecil Relating to the name and powers of the Harris County Improvement District No. 17; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose a tax. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills deleted after last posting: HB 3678 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
